packageMeta.name: purescript-affjax
packageMeta.description: An asynchronous AJAX library built using Aff.

declarations.comments:
A record that contains all the information to perform an HTTP request.
Instead of constructing the record from scratch it is often easier to build
one based on `defaultRequest`.
declarations.title: Request

declarations.comments:
A record of the type `Request` that has all fields set to default
values. This record can be used as the foundation for constructing
custom requests.

As an example:

```purescript
defaultRequest { url = "/api/user", method = Left POST }
```

Would represents a POST request to the URL `/api/user`.
declarations.title: defaultRequest

declarations.comments: The type of records that represents a received HTTP response.
declarations.title: Response

declarations.comments: The possible errors that can occur when making an Affjax request.
declarations.title: Error

declarations.comments: Type alias for URL strings to aid readability of types.
declarations.title: URL

declarations.comments:
Makes an HTTP request.

The example below performs a `GET` request to the URL `/resource` and
interprets the response body as JSON.

```purescript
import Affjax.ResponseFormat (json)
...
request (defaultRequest { url = "/resource", method = Left GET, responseFormat = json})
```

For common cases helper functions can often be used instead of `request` .
For instance, the above example is equivalent to the following.

```purescript
get json "/resource"
```
declarations.title: request

declarations.comments: Makes a `GET` request to the specified URL.
declarations.title: get

declarations.comments: Makes a `POST` request to the specified URL with the option to send data.
declarations.title: post

declarations.comments:
Makes a `POST` request to the specified URL with the option to send data
and ignores the response body.
declarations.title: post_

declarations.comments: Makes a `PUT` request to the specified URL with the option to send data.
declarations.title: put

declarations.comments:
Makes a `PUT` request to the specified URL with the option to send data
and ignores the response body.
declarations.title: put_

declarations.comments: Makes a `DELETE` request to the specified URL.
declarations.title: delete

declarations.comments:
Makes a `DELETE` request to the specified URL and ignores the response
body.
declarations.title: delete_

declarations.comments: Makes a `PATCH` request to the specified URL with the option to send data.
declarations.title: patch

declarations.comments:
Makes a `PATCH` request to the specified URL with the option to send data
and ignores the response body.
declarations.title: patch_

declarations.comments:
Represents data for an HTTP request that will be included in the request
body.
declarations.title: RequestBody

declarations.comments: Used to represent how a HTTP response body should be interpreted.
declarations.title: ResponseFormat

declarations.comments:
Converts a `Response a` into a string representation of the response type
that it represents.
declarations.title: toResponseType
